metadata.author: Recorded Future Premier Integrations - support@recordedfuture.com
metadata.comments: Solution template for Recorded Future Identity

metadata.description: Not used, but needed to pass arm-ttk test `Location-Should-Not-Be-Hardcoded`.  We instead use the `workspace-location` which is derived from the LA workspace
[concat('Region to deploy solution resources -- separate from location selection',parameters('location'))]
Workspace name for Log Analytics where Microsoft Sentinel is setup
Name of custom connector.
Base URL to Recorded Future Identity API.

properties.description: Recorded Future Identity Connector enables access to the Recorded Future Identity Intelligence. The connector has dedicated actions for search and lookup of identity leaks.

info.title: Recorded Future Identity
info.description:
The Recorded Future Identity Intelligence Connector enables security and IT
teams to detect identity compromises, for both employees and customers. To
do this, Recorded Future automates the collection, analysis, and production
of identity intelligence from a vast range of sources. Through this
connector, organizations can incorporate identity intelligence into
automated workflows (e.g., password resets) with applications such as Azure
Active Directory and Microsoft Sentinel.

post.summary: Credential Lookup - Look up credential data for one or more users
post.description: Look up exposed credential data for a specific set of subjects

200.description: Returns detailed information on the exposed credentials

clear_text_hint.description: First two letters of the exposed secret. Only available for secrets exposed in clear text

dumps.description: List of data dumps in which the signature has been involved.

breaches.description: List of data breaches related to the dump

description.example: Evony.com reportedly suffered data breaches in June and August 2016, resulting in the exposure of over 34 million user accounts.

site_description.example: Evony.com is the website of Evony LLC, which develops browser and mobile-based online games.

description.example: This credential data was derived from stealer malware logs. These logs were obtained through Recorded Future\u2019s proprietary sources.

downloaded.description: Date when the dump was downloaded

exposed_secret_format.description: Format of the exposed secret. Either the hash algorithm or clear for cleartext.

first_seen.description: Date when the signature was first seen exposed

last_seen.description: Date when the signature was last seen exposed

malware_family.title: Malware family
malware_family.description: Family of malware used to extract the credentials

secret_hashes.description: List of known hashes of the exposed secret. Calculated by Recorded Future if the secret was exposed in clear text.

secret_rank.description: Any common password collections the password is part of

403.description: Provided token is not authorized to use the API.

post.summary: Credential Search - Search credential data for one or more domains
post.description: Search credential data exposed in data dumps and through malware logs

items.title: Domain
items.description: A domain owned by your organization

200.description: Returns a list exposed credentials related to the searched domains

credential_dumps.title: Credential dumps
credential_dumps.description: List of credentials exposed in data dumps

malware_logs.title: Malware logs
malware_logs.description: List of credentials exposed through malware logs

next_offset.title: Next offset
next_offset.description: Offset used to request succeeding records

403.description: Provided token is not authorized to use the API.

post.summary: Playbook Alerts - Search for novel identity exposures

lookback_days.title: Look back days
lookback_days.description: Number of days to look back for Playbook Alerts

200.description: Returns a list with alerts of novel identity exposures

pba_items.title: Playbook alert items
pba_items.description: List of alerts with novel identity exposures

403.description: Provided token is not authorized to use the API.

put.description: Update a Playbook Alert. Generic alert properties like status, priority and assignee may be updated, or a log message may be appended.

log_entry.description: Freetext log message. Maximum of 5000 characters.

get.summary: Playbook Alerts - Detailed Identity Novel Exposures alert data
get.description: Retrieve detailed information about a Identity Novel Exposures Playbook Alert

parameters.name: return_html
parameters.description: Return HTML for Microsoft Sentinel description and comments

description.example: This credential data was derived from stealer malware logs.

IdentityExposuresStatusPanel.description: Data structure containing general information about the alert and it's associated entity.

targets.description: A list of domains associated with the exposure.

OnwardActionId.description: The id for the type of action taken. The possible values can be found in the response from metadata/common in actions_by_category field. The action ids possible can grow over time

PlaybookAlertCreatorId.description: Id of the Creator of the Playbook Alert

PlaybookAlertCreatorName.description: Full name of the Creator of the Playbook Alert

PlaybookAlertLogPanel.description: Detailed view of manual or automated changes to the alert and underlying data. This version is deprecated and will be removed completely in future updates.

PlaybookAlertLogPanelV2.description: Detailed view of manual or automated changes to the alert and underlying data.

PlaybookAlertPriority.description: The priority of the Playbook Alert.

PlaybookAlertReopenStrategy.description:
Reopen strategies can only be applied to alerts with a status of Dismissed or Resolved.
The following combinations of status/reopen are allowed:
* Dismissed -> Never * Resolved -> Never * Resolved -> SignificantUpdates

PlaybookAlertStatus.description: The status of the Playbook Alert.

status_code.description: Status describing the result of the request.

status_message.description: Text describing the status, suitable for displaying an error.

PlaybookAlertUpdated.description: The Update time of the Playbook Alert

PriorityChange.description: This change applies to any alert type.

RelatedEntitiesChangeV2.description: This change applies to any alert type.

ReopenStrategyChange.description: This change applies to any alert type.

StandardPanels.description: Request inclusion of detailed alert data, grouped into a set of panels. If left unset, all panels will be returned.

StatusChange.description: This change applies to any alert type.

TitleChange.description: This change applies to any alert type.

PlaybookAlertId.name: playbook_alert_id
PlaybookAlertId.description: The unique id of a specific Playbook Alert

metadata.description: Required. Name of the logic app connector which performs Recorded Future Communication. Normally this should not change from RFI-CustomConnector-0-2-0.

entra_id_security_group_id.defaultValue: Insert Entra ID security group or leave empty

metadata.description: Optional. The ID of the Entra ID security group where we should put users who have leaked credentials. If left empty, a user will not be placed in an Entra ID security group.
Optional. If specified, will confirm user as risky. Requires Microsoft Entra ID P1 or P2 license
Optional. If specified, will replace the domain of any leaked credentials with this value.

Compute_user_principal_name.description: Replace the domain of the leaked identity with entra_id_domain, if the entra_id_domain parameter is provided.

body.log_entry: User not found. Might be false positive. Dismissed

Workaround_-_Current_Time.description: This step is only here to handle a specific case where the user is not found but we have a alert id. Without this, the whole run would be seen as "Failed" even though it did everything correct

metadata.title: RFI-Playbook-Alert-Importer
metadata.description: This playbook fetches identity compromises from Recorded Future, places users in a security group and confirms them as 'risky users' in Entra ID.
prerequisites: First install the RFI-CustomConnector-0-2-0 custom connector

To use the Recorded Future Identity connector, you will need a valid API token from Recorded Future as described in the [documentation](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/master/Solutions/Recorded%20Future%20Identity/Playbooks/readme.md#how-to-obtain-recorded-future-api-token)
postDeployment: After deployment, open the playbook to configure all connections and press save.

releaseNotes.title: Improved stability
notes: Removed Get Risky User action due to instability

metadata.description: Required. Name of the logic app connector which performs Recorded Future Communication. Normally this should not change from RFI-CustomConnector-0-2-0.

entra_id_security_group_id.defaultValue: Insert Entra ID security group or leave empty

metadata.description: Optional. The ID of the Entra ID security group where we should put users who have leaked credentials. If left empty, a user will not be placed in an Entra ID security group.
Optional. If specified, will confirm user as risky. Requires Microsoft Entra ID P1 or P2 license
Optional. If specified, will replace the domain of any leaked credentials with this value.
Required. If true, will save each Playbook Alert that matches an existing user to a Log Analytics Workspace table.
Required. The name of the Log Analytics Workspace table where Playbook Alerts should be saved.

Compute_user_principal_name.description: Replace the domain of the leaked identity with entra_id_domain, if the entra_id_domain parameter is provided.

body.log_entry: User not found. Might be false positive. Dismissed

Workaround_-_Current_Time.description: This step is only here to handle a specific case where the user is not found but we have a alert id. Without this, the whole run would be seen as "Failed" even though it did everything correct

properties.descriptionHtml:
Note: Please refer to the following before installing the solution:

• Review the solution Release Notes

• There may be known issues pertaining to this Solution, please refer to them before installing.

Recorded Future Identity Intelligence enables security and IT teams to detect identity compromises, for both employees and customers. To do this, Recorded Future automates the collection, analysis, and production of identity intelligence from a vast range of sources. Organizations can incorporate identity intelligence into automated workflows that regularly monitor for compromised credentials and take immediate action with applications such as Entra ID and Microsoft Sentinel. There are many ways organizations can utilize Recorded Future Identity Intelligence; the playbooks in this Solution are just a quick introduction to some of those ways. In particular, these playbooks include several actions that can be coordinated, or used separately. They include:

  1. searches for compromised workforce or external customer users
  2. looking up existing users and saving the compromised user data to a Log file
  3. confirming high risk Entra ID users
  4. adding a compromised user to an Entra ID security group
  5. Updating Recorded Future Playbook Alerts

For more information, see the Documentation for this Solution.

The playbooks have internal dependencies where you have to install:

  • RFI-CustomConnector-0-2-0

Before:

  • RFI-Playbook-Alert-Importer
  • RFI-Playbook-Alert-Importer-LAW
  • RFI-Playbook-Alert-Importer-LAW-Sentinel.

This solution depends on underlying Microsoft technologies. Some of these dependencies either may be in Preview state or might result in additional ingestion or operational costs:

  • Log Analytics
  • Logic apps

Custom Azure Logic Apps Connectors: 1, Playbooks: 3

Learn more about Microsoft Sentinel | Learn more about Solutions
